patient_info: Inguinal hernia,Hypertension,Hoarse voice,Cardiomegaly,Abnormal aortic valve morphology,Mitral regurgitation,Aortic regurgitation,Abnormal left ventricle morphology,Fever,Palpitations,Dyspnea,Hemoptysis,Bronchiectasis,Decreased body weight,Ascending tubular aorta aneurysm,Abnormal left ventricular function,Abnormal B-type natriuretic peptide concentration,Productive cough
golden_diagnosis: Neonatal Marfan syndrome,Marfan syndrome,马方综合征/Marfan syndrome; MFS/Marfan syndrome,马方综合征/Marfan syndrome; MFS/Marfan syndrome
predict_diagnosis:
1. Marfan syndrome
2. Ehlers-Danlos syndrome
3. Loeys-Dietz syndrome
4. Bicuspid aortic valve
5. Aortic coarctation
6. Pulmonary hypertension
7. Cardiomyopathy, hypertrophic
8. Cardiomyopathy, dilated
9. Restrictive cardiomyopathy
10. Right heart failure

These diagnoses are considered because they can present with a combination of cardiovascular, pulmonary, and systemic features. Marfan syndrome and Ehlers-Danlos syndrome are connective tissue disorders that can affect the cardiovascular system, leading to aortic aneurysms and valvular abnormalities. Loeys-Dietz syndrome is also a connective tissue disorder with similar features. Bicuspid aortic valve is a common valve abnormality that can lead to aortic regurgitation and hypertension. Aortic coarctation is a narrowing of the aorta that can cause hypertension and other symptoms. Pulmonary hypertension can lead to right heart failure and systemic symptoms. Cardiomyopathies, whether hypertrophic, dilated, or restrictive, can present with cardiomegaly, valve abnormalities, and heart failure. Finally, right heart failure can lead to systemic venous congestion and symptoms such as dyspnea and ascites.
